intro: Anemia breuteliana, commonly known as the Breutel's anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features palmately divided leaves and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white, yellow, or pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
